Class GuiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controllers.GuiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameObserver, javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GuiController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, GameObserver
The main GUI controller for the Tetris game.

This class acts as the View + Controller in the MVC architecture, handling:

  • Rendering the game board, next bricks, and hold panel through GameRenderer
  • Receiving user input via KeyManager
  • Forwarding input events to the GameController (the Model)
  • Updating UI when notified through GameObserver
  • Managing UI panels such as pause and game-over screens

Game updates are driven by GameLoopManager, which generates timed tick events that simulate the falling bricks. The GUI controller listens to these ticks and sends DOWN events to the model.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes all UI components, event managers, and the game renderer.

      This method wires together:

      • GameLoopManager – handles the main ticking loop
      • KeyManager – handles keyboard input
      • GameRenderer – draws the board and UI elements
      • SoundManager – plays background music and SFX
      • GameController – the Model that contains game logic

      Observers are registered here so that the GUI receives model updates.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • initGameMode

      public void initGameMode(GameMode mode)
      Applies a selected game mode to the model and adjusts UI visibility (such as enabling or disabling the level counter).
      Parameters:
      mode - the game mode selected by the user

    • onBoardUpdated

      public void onBoardUpdated(ViewData viewData)
      Called when the board state changes. Updates the brick positions and active piece on the screen.
      Specified by:
      onBoardUpdated in interface GameObserver
      Parameters:
      viewData - snapshot of the board and active piece for rendering

      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the full board matrix of locked tiles

    • onGameTick

      private void onGameTick()
      Called by the GameLoopManager at fixed intervals. Pushes a DOWN input event into the model to simulate gravity.
